title: European Parliament approves migration and asylum pact
summary: After nine years of negotiations, Members of the European Parliament definitively adopted a set of texts on Wednesday aimed at harmonizing procedures for the reception of migrants.

title: Champions League: Barcelona beat PSG in thriller to seize edge in tie, Atletico keep advantage on Dortmund
summary: Paris Saint-Germain suffered a 2-3 defeat against Barcelona on Wednesday night at the Parc des Princes in the first leg of the championship quarter-finals. Fellow Atletico Madrid earned themselves a 2-1 first-leg victory over Borussia Dortmund, surviving a late onslaught from the visitors.

title: Biden 'considering' Australian request to drop Assange case
summary: Assange is presently awaiting confirmation regarding his potential final attempt to appeal against extradition, following a recent delay in a British court's decision on his case, now anticipated on May 20. In late March, the High Court in London granted the US three weeks to furnish additional "assurances" concerning his treatment should he be extradited to face charges.

title: South Korea: Opposition party set for big win in election, spelling trouble for President Yoon
summary: According to polls conducted by the three main television networks as voting concluded, the opposition is poised to secure more than 200 seats in the 300-member National Assembly. This "supermajority" would grant them sufficient power to challenge the president's veto rights and potentially even remove him from office.

title: European elections: French candidates are split over whether to use TikTok
summary: While Macron's candidate Valérie Hayer and Socialist Raphaël Glucksmann have decided to forgo TikTok, for fear of Chinese meddling in the election; other candidates have been using it to campaign to younger voters.

title: When it comes to sex, do we set the bar too high?
summary: Media representations of sexuality create insane expectations which can only lead to disappointment in real life. It's time to change our frame of reference, writes columnist Maïa Mazaurette.

title: Biden announces strengthened defense partnership with Japan, with eye on China
summary: The US President received the Japanese PM Kishida at the White House on Wednesday, April 10, highlighting their partnership as "flourishing." The Japanese leader, meanwhile, called for "peace and stability" amid tensions between China and Taiwan.

title: The French telecom sector positions itself for the reconstruction of Ukraine
summary: The InfraNum federation has signed an agreement with the Zelensky government to initiate preparatory work for the restoration and modernization of networks.

title: US promises Israel 'ironclad' support against Iran reprisals
summary: President Joe Biden's promise comes despite his public criticism of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu over the toll on civilians in Israel's campaign against Hamas, especially after a strike killed seven aid workers.

title: Germany denies 'facilitating genocide' in Gaza with its military aid to Israel
summary: Accused by Nicaragua in front of the International Court of Justice, Germany claims that the military equipment delivered to Israel is either defensive in nature or intended for training purposes.

title: Backtracking on climate policy is a sign of populist pressure
summary: The French government is justifying his climate incation by the rise of the far right in the polls ahead of the June European elections.

title: Switzerland announces Ukraine peace conference in June, says Russia won't attend
summary: Russia criticized the event as being part of a scheme by US President Joe Biden's Democratic Party ahead of this year's presidential election.

title: Mali: Junta 'suspends' political party activities for 'subversion'
summary: Since seizing power, solidified by a second coup in May 2021, the junta has undertaken numerous acts of defiance, severing longstanding ties with France and its European partners, and shifting its military and political allegiance towards Russia.

title: 'We're less and less together, but more and more side by side, eyes glued to our screens'
summary: As faces are blocked by screens and personalities hidden behind avatars, French sociology professor David Le Breton laments on the disappearance of the public sphere.

title: Journalism and Crisis: Join Le Monde in English for a special event in New York!
summary: Le Monde's English edition crosses the Atlantic from April 15-17 for a series of events in New York City, free and open to the public.

title: Paris 2024: New tickets to be released
summary: The Paris Olympics are set to take place from July 26-August 11 followed by the Paralympics from August 28-September 8.

title: What the French bill on end of life allows compared to its European neighbors
summary: Le Monde has listed the most frequent conditions that have led to euthanasia in Belgium and the Netherlands, and imagined the fate of the same patients in France if the draft law on 'aid in dying' were to be voted as it stands.

title: US announces nationwide tap water standards against PFAS 'forever chemicals'
summary: The new Environmental Protection Agency standards announced by the Biden administration set maximum levels of 5 different toxic PFAS chemicals, aiming to prevent deaths and illnesses from exposure to them.

title: What is celebrated on Eid al-Fitr?
summary: On Wednesday, April 10, Muslims celebrate the end of the fasting practiced during the month of Ramadan.

title: In Brazil, indigenous peoples achieve initial recognition amidst widespread apathy
summary: For the first time in the country's history, the President of the Amnesty Commission for reparations of crimes committed during the military dictatorship has extended an apology to indigenous populations. However, this gesture does not alleviate the ongoing humanitarian crisis.

title: Israeli strike in Gaza kills 3 of Hamas leader Haniyeh's sons
summary: Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh, who has been based in Qatar since 2019, lost three sons, Hazem, Amir and Mohammad, in an Israeli strike on their car, according to statements from both the Israeli army and Haniyeh himself.

title: French court upholds labeling vegetarian patties as 'steak'
summary: France's top administrative court suspended a second French government decree to ban the use of 21 terms – usually used to describe meat, such as 'steak' or 'ham' – in labels on plant-based products, pending an EU court ruling on the issue.

title: South Korea: PM and top presidential officials offer to resign after election defeat
summary: Wednesday's election was widely seen as a midterm confidence vote on Yoon, a former top prosecutor who took office in 2022 for a single five-year term.

title: Could tea be the new wine?
summary: With a tea master to prepare each 'grand cru' and a sommelier to serve it by the glass to compliment each dish, France boasts about 20 restaurants where you can discover aromatic bombs that are the perfect accompaniment to a gastronomic meal.

title: Macron's risky gamble on Ukraine for the EU elections
summary: At this point, the French president's strategy of making aid to Ukraine a key issue of the campaign has above all given breathing room to 'pro-Russian' parties.

title: Zara and H&M's jeans linked to deforestation in Brazil's Cerrado
summary: An investigation published by the British organization Earthsight exposes the pitfalls of industrial cotton farming in the Brazilian savanna, a rich and crucial ecosystem for carbon storage.

title: New York City settles to pay $17.5 million for forcing women to remove their hijabs in mug shots
summary: The agreement, which still has to be approved by a judge, is the consequence of a class-action suit brought in 2018 by two Muslim women. It will benefit some 3,600 people who have been forced to remove their religious head coverings by the city's police.

title: Ukraine's parliament passes controversial mobilization law
summary: The new law voted by parliament on Thursday will not allow long-serving soldiers to be discharged from the army, angering many troops and their families.

title: US inflation lingers on
summary: Consumer price inflation continued to accelerate in America in March, up 3.5% year-on-year. Hopes are receding of a rapid rate cut by the Fed.

title: European elections: Ursula von der Leyen's campaign gets off to a rocky start
summary: The European Commission president, who is standing for re-election, is implicated in several affairs, in particular the appointment of a fellow CDU member to a lucrative position, which was rejected by the EU Parliament.

title: Attending France's only university course for inmates: 'It feels good to think, take notes and read'
summary: Carried out in La Santé prison by teachers from Paris Cité, the courses are a breath of fresh air for the young enrolled inmates.

title: 2024 Cannes Film Festival: Coppola returns with epic 'Megalopolis'
summary: The 77th Cannes Film Festival unveiled its line-up on Thursday. This year's jury will be led by 'Barbie' director Greta Gerwig.

title: In eastern DRC, the wounds of the genocide in Rwanda are still raw
summary: The Goma region, where many Rwandans fled in 1994, remains the scene of endless local insurgencies often backed by foreign powers, including Kigali.

title: Italy's Matteo Salvini is weakened by his extreme stance
summary: Largely outstripped by Giorgia Meloni on the far right, the leader of the League party and deputy prime minister must now face a mounting challenge from within his own party.

title: At the roots of evangelical Christians' support for Israel
summary: Evangelical Christians, particularly in the US and Latin America, have been stepping up their support for Israel since October 7, 2023.

title: Behind the Faye-Sonko duo's swift rise to power in Senegal
summary: Just 10 days before the presidential election, the two incarcerated men regained their freedom and campaigned to win in a landslide in the first round.

title: EU lawmakers back call to enshrine abortion in EU rights charter
summary: With 373 votes to 163, MEPs in Brussels voted a symbolic resolution to put access to abortion in the EU's Charter of Fundamental Rights, following France's example, just as a tense debate on the issue was held in Poland.

title: OJ Simpson, ex-NFL star aquitted in the 'trial of the century', dies aged 76
summary: According to a statement by his family, the former football player, who was aquitted of his wife and her friend's murder in 1995, died of cancer.

title: Kremlin opponent Navalny's posthumous memoir out in October
summary: The book chronicles his 2020 nerve agent poisoning and life in a brutal Russian prison camp, where he died in February 2024.

title: Mexico files international lawsuit on Ecuador over embassy raid
summary: The suit, filed with the International Court of Justice (ICJ), requests Ecuador's suspension from the United Nations until it issues a public apology acknowledging the violation of the 'norms of international law.'

title: Human Rights groups file UN complaint over French police racial profiling
summary: Human Rights Watch, Amnesty International France, as well as three other French groups, claim that police identity checks abusively target those 'perceived as black or Arab' and 'constitute systemic racial discrimination.'
